Description: Glazed composition shabti of Hor: the surface glaze, originally green, has partly disappeared leaving a brown patination. Hor wears a striated lappet wig and a long plaited beard, and he has crossed arms holding two hoes in relief, seed-bag over left shoulder, eight lines of hieroglyphs inscribed on front giving chapter 6 from the 'Book of the Dead'. It has an uninscribed back-pillar.
Excavator/field collector: Field Collection by: Dr Gideon Algernon Mantell
Curator's comments: Bibliography: J.H. Taylor and N.C. Strudwick, Mummies: Death and the Afterlife in Ancient Egypt. Treasures from The British Museum, Santa Ana and London 2005, p. 233, pl. on p. 233.
Bibliographic references: Taylor & Strudwick 2005 / Mummies: Death and the Afterlife in Ancient Egypt (p.233)
Exhibition history: Exhibited: 2005-2008, California, The Bowers Museum, Death and Afterlife in Ancient Egypt
